body: With the Technologist feat, you can use Disable Device to interact safely with explosive devices and disable technological devices and traps.
name: Disable Device
url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Skills/Disable Device

sections.body: If you possess a detonator, you can arm an explosive weapon as a trap. Connecting a detonator to an explosive requires a successful DC 10 Disable Device check. Failure means that the attempt fails, but you can attempt to arm the explosive again. Failure by 5 or more means the explosive is triggered as the detonator is installed. You can attempt to make an explosive difficult to disarm. To do so, choose a target disarm DC of 15 or higher, with a DC increment of 5. This becomes your target DC to set the explosive as well as the DC to disarm the explosive.
sections.name: Arm Explosive
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Skills/Disable Device/Arm Explosive

sections.body: Disabling an electronically controlled trap or unlocking an electronically locked door is easier if you use an e-pick. Without an e-pick, you take a -5 penalty on any attempt to use Disable Device on an electronic device.
sections.name: Disable Electronic Device
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Skills/Disable Device/Disable Electronic Device

sections.body: Disarming an explosive requires the character to succeed at a Disable Device check as if disarming a trap. The DC is usually 10, unless the person who set the explosive successfully did so with a higher disarm DC. A failure to disarm an explosive by 5 or more immediately triggers the explosive.
sections.name: Disarm Explosive
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Skills/Disable Device/Disarm Explosive

sections.body: A character can take 10 when using Disable Device to arm or disarm explosives, but cannot take 20.
sections.name: Special
sections.url: pfsrd://Technology Guide/Rules/Technology in the world/Skills/Disable Device/Special

sections.body: Arming an explosive device takes 1 minute or more, depending on the scope of the job. Disarming an explosive is treated as if the explosive were a complex trap, and takes 2d4 rounds to attempt.
